forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. West southwest wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 8am. Mostly sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
In the early hours of this night, Downtown San Francisco drapes itself in a cloak of moisture and muted tones, with only a whisper of drizzle murmuring through the air. As the low clouds slide gracefully over the horizon, a mild chill settles around 57 degrees, accented by a west-southwest wind that dances gently, now and then picking up a slight gust. The chance for precipitation lingers at a modest 20%, an invitation for soft raindrops that might grace the streets after 11 PM. 

Tomorrow dawns with a hint of optimism, as the clouds begin to part and allow glimpses of sunlight to filter through. With a high near 66 degrees, it promises to be a pleasant day, albeit cool, with temperatures easing into the lower 60s by afternoon. The winds will remain brisk, caressing the city’s iconic landmarks with refreshing breezes. One might consider layering; a light jacket over a shirt would suit the temperament of this changing atmosphere. As the day unfolds, it presents numerous possibilities: a stroll along Embarcadero, perhaps a quiet café visit to savor a warm beverage, or simply a leisurely exploration of the waterfront basked in the soft embrace of sunshine.
